quote: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want. He makes me lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters. He restores my soul.
Allah does not burden a soul beyond that it can bear. [Quran 2:286]
Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for human masters.
The soul is neither born nor does it die; it is eternal, imperishable, and ancient. It is not destroyed when the body is destroyed.
Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to Him, and He will make your paths straight.
When you have faith in Allah and follow His guidance, peace will fill your heart, and difficulties will become opportunities.
You are the light of the world. A city set on a hill cannot be hidden; nor does anyone light a lamp and put it under a basket, but on the lampstand, and it gives light to all who are in the house.
As a lotus flower is born in water, grows in water and rises out of water to stand above it unsoaked, so I teach you to live in the world.
The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.
In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer.
source: Inspired by Sikh teachings of resilience

quote: The spiritual journey is individual, highly personal. It can't be organized or regulated. It isn't true that everyone should follow one path. Listen to your own truth.
Seek knowledge from the cradle to the grave.
The self is the friend of a man who masters himself through the self, but for a man without self-mastery, the self is like an enemy.
Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.
source: Inspired by Jewish Teachings of Peace

quote: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
Before you speak, let your words pass through three gates: Is it true? Is it necessary? Is it kind?
The best among you are those who have the best manners and character.
Ahimsa paramo dharma - Non-violence is the highest moral virtue.
Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
The universe is not outside of you. Look inside yourself; everything that you want, you already are.
Silence is the language of God, all else is poor translation.
Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.
source: Inspired by Christian Teachings of Redemption

quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
As a person sheds worn-out garments and puts on new ones, so does the embodied soul shed its worn-out bodies and enter into new ones.
Indeed, Allah will not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves.
To understand everything is to forgive everything.
The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
Your inner voice is your most powerful guide; learn to listen to it.
Those who have loved are those who have found God.
Where there is forgiveness, there is God.
He who has no faith in himself can never have faith in God.
Truth is high, but higher still is truthful living.
What we think, we become. The mind is everything.
The world is as we are; tree of poison, tree of nectar are we.
When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.
The self is hidden in the hearts of all, as butter lies hidden in cream.
There is nothing noble in being superior to your fellow man; true nobility is being superior to your former self.
The wise see the same in all — whether it be a learned and humble priest, a cow, an elephant, a dog, or a dog-eater.
Be merciful to others, just as your Father is merciful to you.
Verily, with every hardship comes ease.
Live and let live - this is the essence of Jain philosophy.
For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son.
Kindness is a mark of faith, and whoever is not kind has no faith.
Do not let your difficulties fill you with anxiety, after all it is only in the darkest nights that stars shine more brightly.
Knowledge is power and it can command obedience. A man of knowledge during his lifetime can make people obey and follow him.
The tongue is like a lion. If you let it loose, it will wound someone.
A moment of patience in a moment of anger prevents a thousand moments of regret.
The strongest among you is the one who controls his anger.
Who is wise? One who learns from every person.
What is hateful to you, do not do to your fellow.
The highest form of wisdom is kindness.
Say little and do much.
If I am not for myself, who will be for me? If I am only for myself, what am I?
Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you.
Do not judge, or you too will be judged.
For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?
Be kind and compassionate to one another, forgiving each other, just as in Christ God forgave you.
Let all that you do be done in love.
Your heart is the size of an ocean. Go find yourself in its hidden depths.
What you seek is seeking you.
The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
The universe is not outside of you. Look inside yourself; everything that you want, you already are.
The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear.
Man is the measure of all things.
The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive.
Death does not concern us, because as long as we exist, death is not here. And when it comes, then we do not exist.
The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that very existence is an act of rebellion.
One should as a rule respect public opinion in so far as is necessary to avoid starvation and imprisonment, but anything beyond this is voluntary submission to an unnecessary tyranny.
The only real freedom is freedom of thought. Everything else follows from that.
Do not believe in anything simply because you have heard it. But believe in nothing unless you yourself have tested and verified it.
The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate.
We are dying from overthinking. We are slowly killing ourselves by drowning in our thoughts. We cannot silence our minds.
All knowledge begins with wonder.
The unexamined life is not worth living.
In the depth of winter, I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
It is the marks of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
The meaning of life is what we give to it through our actions and choices.
I think, therefore I am.
The only constant in life is change.
Everything is in flux; everything flows.
Live simply so that others may simply live.
The only true path to enlightenment is through reason and observation.
Happiness is achieved by the practice of virtue.
The basis of morality is not religious dogma, but human compassion.
Freedom is not the absence of commitments, but the ability to choose what to commit to.
We are not makers of history. We are made by history.
The best way to predict your future is to create it.
Know thyself.
In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice.
And whoever puts their trust in Allah, then He will suffice him.
The most beloved of deeds to Allah are those that are most consistent, even if they are small.
And We have certainly made the Quran easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?

Take advantage of five before five: your youth before your old age, your health before your sickness, your wealth before your poverty, your free time before your busyness, and your life before your death.
Do not lose hope, nor be sad. You will surely be victorious if you are true believers.
Be in this world as though you were a stranger or a traveler.
And speak to people good words.
Whoever is grateful — it is for the benefit of his own soul. And whoever is ungrateful — my Lord is Self-Sufficient and Generous.
The one who repents from sin is like the one who has no sin at all.
Truly in the heart there is a sadness that cannot be removed except with the happiness of knowing Allah.
So remember Me; I will remember you. Be thankful to Me, and never be ungrateful.
None of you truly believes until he wishes for his brother what he wishes for himself.
This world is a prison for the believer and a paradise for the disbeliever.
O son of Adam, you have nothing of this world except what you ate and consumed, what you wore and it became worn out, and what you gave in charity and it was stored for you.
When Allah loves a servant, He tests him.
Patience is the key to relief.
O you who have believed, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
The dunya is not the resting place, it is the testing place.
If you are grateful, I will surely increase you in favor. But if you deny, indeed My punishment is severe.
And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love Him, who have been called according to His purpose.
I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me.
Fear not, for I am with you; be not dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you, I will help you, I will uphold you with my righteous right hand.
For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.
Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.
Blessed is the one who perseveres under trial because, having stood the test, that person will receive the crown of life.
Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.
For God has not given us a spirit of fear, but of power and of love and of a sound mind.
Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!
Cast all your anxiety on Him because He cares for you.
Above all else, guard your heart, for everything you do flows from it.
Be still, and know that I am God.
Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid; do not be discouraged, for the Lord your God will be with you wherever you go.
He has shown you, O mortal, what is good. And what does the Lord require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.
The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.
But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.
Now faith is confidence in what we hope for and assurance about what we do not see.
The steadfast love of the Lord never ceases; His mercies never come to an end; they are new every morning; great is your faithfulness.
There is no fear in love. But perfect love drives out fear, because fear has to do with punishment.
Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind.
You have the right to work, but never to the fruit of work.
From anger comes delusion; from delusion, loss of memory; from loss of memory, the destruction of intelligence; and from the destruction of intelligence one perishes.
Even as a tortoise draws in its limbs, the wise can draw in their senses at will.
The mind is restless and difficult to restrain, but it is subdued by practice.
He who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me, I am not lost to him, nor is he lost to Me.
The self-controlled soul, who moves among sense objects free from attraction and repulsion, attains tranquility.
One who sees inaction in action, and action in inaction, is intelligent among men.
Arise, awake, and stop not till the goal is reached.
Lead me from the unreal to the real, from darkness to light, from death to immortality.
Truth alone triumphs, not falsehood.
The whole world is one family.
Tat tvam asi — Thou art that.
May all beings be happy. May all beings be free from suffering. May all beings find peace.
Better indeed is knowledge than mechanical practice. Better than knowledge is meditation.
Perform your obligatory duty, because action is indeed better than inaction.
The faith of each is in accordance with one's own nature.
There is nothing lost or wasted in this life.
Reshape yourself through the power of your will; never let yourself be degraded by self-will.
The senses are higher than the body, the mind higher than the senses; above the mind is the intellect, and above the intellect is the Self.
That which is the finest essence — this whole world has that as its soul. That is reality. That is the Self.
Let your aim be the good of all.
When a man is free from desire, his mind and heart find eternal peace.
Justice, justice shall you pursue.
You shall love your neighbor as yourself.
Whoever saves a single life, it is as if they saved the entire world.
It is not upon you to finish the work, but neither are you free to desist from it.
The world stands on three things: Torah, divine service, and acts of loving-kindness.
In a place where there are no men, strive to be a man.
Who is rich? One who is happy with what they have.
Be of the disciples of Aaron: loving peace and pursuing peace.
The righteous of all nations have a share in the world to come.
Deeds of kindness are equal in weight to all the commandments.
Turn it and turn it, for everything is in it.
Pray as if everything depended on God. Act as if everything depended on you.
The beginning of wisdom is the fear of the Lord.
Do not judge your fellow until you have stood in their place.
A good name is better than precious oil.
Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one.
I have set before you life and death, blessing and curse. Therefore choose life.
Love truth and peace.
Words that come from the heart enter the heart.
When you teach your son, you teach your son's son.
There is no person who does not have their hour.
Where there is no bread, there is no Torah; where there is no Torah, there is no bread.
Repair the world.
Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
Hatred does not cease by hatred, but only by love; this is the eternal rule.
An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.
Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
In the end, only three things matter: how much you loved, how gently you lived, and how gracefully you let go of things not meant for you.
No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.
Every morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most.
Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.
The root of suffering is attachment.
Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
Pain is certain, suffering is optional.
Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.
All that we are is the result of what we have thought. The mind is everything. What we think we become.
There is no path to happiness: happiness is the path.
To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind.
If you light a lamp for someone else, it will also brighten your path.
The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
Nothing ever exists entirely alone; everything is in relation to everything else.
A disciplined mind brings happiness.
Radiate boundless love towards the entire world — above, below, and across.
If anything is worth doing, do it with all your heart.
Conquer anger with non-anger. Conquer badness with goodness. Conquer meanness with generosity. Conquer dishonesty with truth.
Your worst enemy cannot harm you as much as your own unguarded thoughts.
It is better to travel well than to arrive.
One moment can change a day, one day can change a life, and one life can change the world.
Even Kings and emperors with heaps of wealth and vast dominion cannot compare with an ant filled with the love of God.
Burn worldly love, rub the ashes and make ink of it, make the heart the pen, the intellect the writer.
Conquer your mind and you conquer the world.
One cannot comprehend Him through reason, even if one reasoned for ages.
Speak only that which will bring you honor.
Dwell in peace in the home of your own being, and the Messenger of Death will not be able to touch you.
As you plant, so shall you harvest.
There is but one God. True is His Name, creative His personality, and immortal His form.
Whatever you desire, ask from God alone.
Running away from the world is not the way. One must find peace within the world.
Through selfless service, eternal peace is obtained.
God is one, but He has innumerable forms.
Let compassion be your cotton, contentment your thread, modesty your knot, and truth your twist.
If you want the fruits of love and peace, plant the seeds of humility.
Recognize the Lord's Light within all, and do not consider social class or status.
The highest religion is to rise to universal brotherhood; aye, to consider all creatures your equals.
One cannot be a saint outside while being a thief at heart.
Meditation is the key to the door of liberation.
True is the Master, true is His Name — speak it with infinite love.
Share your earnings with others, eat together, and give to those in need. This is the true path.
Nanak, the whole world is in distress. He who believes in the Name becomes victorious.
Without virtue, all are without merit and without worth.
Only those who are awake in the love of God are truly alive.
Every soul is in itself absolutely omniscient and blissful. The bliss does not come from outside.
Do not injure, abuse, oppress, enslave, insult, torment, torture, or kill any creature or living being.
All souls are alike; none is superior or inferior.
Anger begets more anger, and forgiveness and love lead to more forgiveness and love.
The greatest mistake of a soul is non-recognition of its real self, and it can only be corrected by recognizing itself.
Have compassion for all beings — rich and poor alike; each has their suffering.
There is no enemy outside our soul. The real enemies live inside us — anger, pride, greed, and attachment.
Silence and self-control is non-violence.
In happiness and suffering, in joy and grief, we should regard all creatures as we regard our own self.
Kill not, cause no pain. Nonviolence is the greatest religion.
All human beings are miserable due to their own faults, and they themselves can be happy by correcting these faults.
A living body is not merely an integration of limbs and flesh but it is the abode of the soul.
Can you hold a red-hot iron rod in your hand merely because someone wants you to do so? Then why should you mentally bear the burden of anger towards anyone?
Respect for all living beings is non-violence.
The soul comes alone and goes alone; no one companying it and no one playing the role of a foe.
Attachment and aversion are the root cause of karma, and karma originates from infatuation.
Fight with yourself; why fight with external foes? He who conquers himself through himself will obtain happiness.
One who neglects or disregards the existence of earth, air, fire, water, and vegetation disregards his own existence.
The soul is the master of its own destiny.
Real gold does not fear the test of fire.
All breathing, existing, living, sentient creatures should not be slain, nor treated with violence.
Liberation is achieved not by rituals but by the conquest of passions.
A wise person treats all living beings as he would treat himself.
Forgiveness is the ornament of the brave.
The greatest wealth is contentment; the greatest disease is greed.
Truthfulness is the foundation of all virtues.
Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray.
Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing, there is a field. I'll meet you there.
The soul has been given its own ears to hear things the mind does not understand.
Stop acting so small. You are the universe in ecstatic motion.
Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.
Be like the sun for grace and mercy. Be like the night to cover others' faults. Be like running water for generosity.
Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.
Where there is ruin, there is hope for a treasure.
The garden of the world has no limits, except in your mind.
You were born with wings, why prefer to crawl through life?
Love is the bridge between you and everything.
The moon stays bright when it doesn't avoid the night.
You are not a drop in the ocean. You are the entire ocean in a drop.
When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you, a joy.
Close your eyes, fall in love, stay there.
The only lasting beauty is the beauty of the heart.
Die before you die and find that there is no death.
I want to sing like the birds sing, not worrying about who hears or what they think.
Patience is not sitting and waiting, it is foreseeing. It is looking at the thorn and seeing the rose.
In each moment the fire rages, it will burn away a hundred veils and carry you a thousand steps toward your goal.
Become the sky. Take an axe to the prison wall. Escape.
